attributes.action:
A FAIR SOLUTION TO BRITAIN'S IMMIGRATION PROBLEM
Our rulers - Mrs Merkel and
attributes.additional_details:
that will ensure Britain gets landed with most of the flood of human beings pouring into Europe.
 
But why not link the number of refugees each country takes to its population density?
 
Here is how it works out.
 
One of europe's most densely populated England.
England's population density is 413 people per square kilometre (413 ppl/km2).
 To reach the same population density as England (413 ppl/km2), Germany could take 67 million migrants, France could take 160 million and Spain 161 million.
attributes.background:
Hollande - have demanded that all European countries take their "fair share" of the (mainly Muslim) migrant hordes over-running Europe's apparently unguarded borders.
 
But how do you decide what a "fair share" is? Merkel and Hollande try to link each country by its GDP

rejection.details: The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for how many migrants other EU countries take.
